area_name: Uptown Rock - Lower Tier (aka Delta Wall)

content.description: This is the farthest right route at the Lower Tier.  Climb a single, long pitch along edges, smears, side pulls, etc.  While the easiest way up is no harder than 5.8, it is quite possible to make things harder.  Note: if you belay at the platform and not at the base of the vertical section/1st bolt you're going to run out of rope with a 70m.  Tie in beforehand or put a knot in the end!
content.protection: 19 bolts (+1 bolt if you clip the last bolt of unknown c)

content.description: This is the 3rd route from the left and the first route (from the left) that starts a little higher up the lower tier.  See the beta pic for a better understanding of where routes are located.  It is possible to stop at the midway anchor, but most will climb this route as one long (70m) pitch.  There are several sections that feel on the easier side of 5.9.  Note: this is a rope stretcher.  Tie in beforehand or at least put a knot in the end of the rope.

This is the route immediately right of Feldspar Fixer. Start in an easy chimney/groove and head up the face on awesome thin edges. The crux comes between the 3 and 5th bolts and is 4 star edging. The route eases off significantly after that. It is recommended to climb the route in two pitches and belay at the midway anchor.

This is the farthest left (lowest start) of the 4 routes on the Lower Tier.  There is a short crux around the 3rd bolt, the rest of the route is significantly easier.  It is recommended to break this route into two pitches, using the anchor encountered about 3/4 of the way to the top.  The 1st pitch has fantastic position, moving along the arete above Delta Wall and the 2nd pitch yields surprisingly fun moves.

pathTokens: Uptown Rock - Lower Tier (aka Delta Wall)
